section.title: Past tenses review
section.sectiontitle: Use the Past Simple, Past Continuous and Past Perfect together in narratives. Use the Past Simple for main completed events and the Past Continuous for the background action.
section.text1a: The phone rang while I was sleeping.
section.text2: Mark watched TV. He heard a strange noise.
section.text2a: Mark was watching TV when he heard a strange noise.
section.sectiontitle2: Use the Past Perfect to show that one action happened before another in the past.
section.text3: I ate the apples. There were none left.
section.text3a: There were no more apples because I'd eaten them all.
section.text4: I finished reading the book. I returned it to the library.
section.text4a: I returned the book when I'd finished reading it.
